name: ABACUS
description: We aim to bring together British and Chinese cultures with multiple events to cater for everyone - from hotpot and karaoke to ice skating and bowling. We plan exciting events throughout the year, such as celebrations for Chinese New Year, Christmas and so on! Being a part of the London ABACUS network allows us to host events at exclusive venues across the city alongside seven other universities. As a diverse society, our members range from BBCs (British Born Chinese) and any international students to anyone interested in Chinese culture. By joining ABACUS, you will also have access to discounts at an array of Chinese restaurants and caf√©s across London. So what are you waiting for? Join IC ABACUS today! For more information, check us out on Facebook (Imperial College ABACUS Facebook group) and Instagram (@ic_abacus). Send us a message on our Instagram to get signed up to our mailing list! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: ABACUS promotes cultural exchange and hosts diverse events appealing to a wide range of students.
suggestedApproach: Offer LSN's event promotion to extend the reach of their cultural celebrations.

name: Canadian Society
description: Missing a cup of good old timmies double-double with timbits? Did someone say poutine? Wanna find out where to get good maple syrup? Eager to bash the U.S on their current political circus? Then join us at the Canadian Society! We aim to provide a chill place to just hang out with fellow Canadians, Half-Canadians, or anyone who is generally interested in Canadian culture! Throughout the year we will organise a plethora of fun events to celebrate things that we all miss from home, including thanksgiving celebrations (the correct one), Hockey nights and ice skating. We also plan on bringing you a careers talk with various Canadian companies present in London later in the year, inviting big names like Bombardier and RBC. Renowned for our politeness, we will welcome with open arms anyone who would desire a taste of ‚Äúthe true North‚Äù, and of course, if you are Canadian and are feeling homesick, here is the best place to cure it! CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Canadian Society's description suggests events that would be relatable to Canadian expats or anyone interested in Canadian culture.
suggestedApproach: Emphasize the ability to connect them with other students interested in Canadian culture.

name: Chinese
description: Being one of the largest Chinese societies in the UK, Imperial College Chinese Society aims to promote and integrate Chinese culture within the student community and to serve as the stepping stone for unifying all Chinese students studying abroad. This year, on top of the social events that we have organized in the past such as the Freshers' Dinner, Variety Show, inter-university sports events, and CNY celebrations, we also plan to organize investment banking talks and leadership workshops to enhance the job prospect of our members. Come join our family and meet lifelong friends! CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Chinese society's cultural events, like Freshers' Dinner and CNY celebrations, are attractive to a wide audience.
suggestedApproach: Highlight the opportunities to promote their cultural events and connect with a large audience.

name: Cinema
description: Oh, you're also on a budget because student life in London is expensive? We have that covered too: our tickets are all under ¬£5 per person per film (and you can get even better deals during our All-NighterTM (not an actual trademark please don't sue). We offer professional quality screenings with our 33ft screen and 7-channel Dolby Digital EX surround sound. We own both a as well as having a homebrew 3D system, isn't that cool? We think it's cool. If you also think it's cool and are interested in learning how all of these cool gadgets work, please don't hesitate to contact us to join our projectionists team (and watch films for free)! We are an independent cinema, that projects twice a week (with exceptional ). CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer
relevanceReasoning: Cinema society offers affordable screenings with high quality sound and screen which could greatly appeal to students across London.
suggestedApproach: Highlight the affordability and quality of their screenings to attract students city-wide.

name: Climate Entrepreneurs
description: The Climate Entrepreneurs Club creates an ecosystem to inspire and enable entrepreneurial students to apply their skills by building ventures that address multiple layers linked to climate change, such as related UN SDGs. Throughout the year, we will be hosting events featuring CEOs and investors in the climate tech space, as well as workshops and networking events with like-minded students from other universities. Join us if you have an entrepreneurial mindset and want to build the network and skill set to have a real impact in the world! We welcome all levels of experience, from Climate Geeks to newcomers. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Climate Entrepreneurs offers an ecosystem to inspire students with an entrepreneurial mindset across universities.
suggestedApproach: Emphasize the opportunity to network with other students in the climate tech space.

name: DramSoc
description: We do everything related to theatre: acting, set, costume, lighting, sound, writing, stage management, directing, production, and more. There‚Äôs plenty to get involved in! DramSoc own and operate the full range of state-of-the-art entertainment equipment, and our technical team run events across college, from MTSoc shows to Summer Ball. We take pride in training our members as theatre technicians, actors and directors. We run weekly workshops, including backstage tours, improvisation, set-building, lighting design, and much more, and many of our alumni graduate to become theatre professionals. We stage 2 plays per term, with recent productions including Romeo and Juliet, Waiting for Godot, and a 5 star Edinburgh Fringe show. We produce a range of work written by students, and established playwrights. This really is the place to be if you love theatre! To hear about opportunities to join the team (auditions, workshops, etc) join our mailing lists at dramsoc.org/talk. For general queries, contact president@dramsoc.org. To hire DramSoc for your event, contact techdir@dramsoc.org. Follow us on instagram @ic_dramsoc or havew a look at our website http://dramsoc.org/ to see what we‚Äôre all about! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer
relevanceReasoning: DramSoc offers a wide range of activities appealing to students beyond Imperial, including acting, tech, and production, and runs events across the college.
suggestedApproach: Highlight the society's technical theatre expertise and potential for cross-university collaborations on productions.

name: Entrepreneurs
description: Welcome to Imperial Entrepreneurs! No matter what course you are in - if you have an idea, want to share it, learn how to make it real or simply meet ambitious individuals, join us! We aim to give our society members a solid understanding of the process each start-up founder needs to go through to turn their idea into reality. Our objective is to host events related to innovation and entrepreneurship and allow you to find your co-founder through one of our events. This year, we are excited to present a variety of headline events, including IdeaForge, our very own incubator program designed to support innovative startups. The annual London Startup Fair will showcase emerging startups and provide valuable networking opportunities. Additionally, we will host a formal Gala Dinner to foster connections within the community. Our focus on entrepreneurship in leading new fields will feature panels and fireside chats on pioneering sectors and trends. At our social events, you will meet like-minded people with whom you can exchange ideas, have fun and make valuable friends for life. Come, listen and ask questions - we are sure you can create the next unicorn. Follow us on social media: Want to reach out? Email us at entrepreneurs@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
relevanceReasoning: Entrepreneurs society aims to facilitate the process of turning ideas into reality, an attractive offering for a broad range of students.
suggestedApproach: Propose a joint networking event with entrepreneurship societies at other London universities.

name: Erasmus Student Network - ESN
description: ERASMUS Club is for all exchange students visiting Imperial, all Imperial students going on exchange, and in fact, anyone really! We run activities and events for members throughout the year. It's your chance to get to know a little more about the UK and some of its traditions, as well as fellow exchange students. In addition to organising weekly events and huge parties, the Erasmus committee will help you get to know each other, London, and the whole of Britain! Previous events included pub crawls, trips to Winter Wonderland, Oxford and Scotland, as well as meals and club nights in the most central locations in London! Furthermore, our Buddy System will pair you up with local Imperial students eager to show you around campus and share with you all their tips on how to make the most of your time with us. Everyone is welcome! For further information, don't hesitate to contact us at erasmus@imperial.ac.uk, or follow us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/erasmusimperial/). See you soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
tagline: Welcome to Erasmus Student Network - ESN
relevanceReasoning: Erasmus Student Network is designed to welcome exchange students, and could benefit from wider exposure.
suggestedApproach: Offer to promote their events to other university's international student communities.

name: Indian
description: We‚Äôll begin with our annual Meet and Greet, a three-course dinner giving Freshers the chance to get to know our society and Mums and Dads where new members are paired with older years for guidance and advice on university life. We'll move onto Friction, our annual Bollywood club night attracting freshers across London! We also organise Just Bollywood, the premier national inter-university fusion dance competition, that takes place in early December. In January, we host Utsav - our flagship ball that has 300 members held in a banqueting hall with dance performances, open-bar and photo booths! IndianSoc is perhaps best known for our annual culture and variety show, East Meets West, currently in its 30th year! As the longest-running student show in the UK, EMW showcases the varied music, drama and dance talent here at Imperial, with stunning performances from our own members, as well as other university societies such as PSoc and Malaysian Society. At the heart of all the fun, all of our events continue to raise thousands of pounds for charity every year. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
relevanceReasoning: Indian Society hosts large-scale events like Bollywood nights and balls that attract students from across London.

name: Sri Lankan
description: A close-knit family more than a ‚Äúsociety‚Äù, the IC Sri Lankan Society was founded over 30 years ago. We are one of the oldest, most successful of all societies, managing the 2nd largest budget at Imperial College Union. Our goal is to bring the vibrancy, diversity & warmth of Sri Lankan culture to Imperial, and to the UK. Our flagship event ‚ÄúSapphire‚Äù (fb.com/ICsapphire) is the largest Lankan event in the UK! A dinner dance that attracts over 1000 guests from across the country to enjoy authentic Sri Lankan food, the hottest Sri Lankan entertainment, & the company of all your friends across the country. We have raised ¬£75,000 since our inception for charities uplifting Sri Lanka including aiding children in the Northern Province gain access to clean drinking water as well as helping restore eyesight to 1000s through cataract operations. By contributing to Sapphire 2022s success, not only will you help raise an invaluable contribution to philanthropic ventures back home, but you will develop a skill set that is in short supply & in high demand. Our celebration of Lankan culture extends throughout the year; from the Warwick University Cricket Tournament and our Christmas & Avurudhu meals! We look forward to seeing you at our baila-jam sessions, our weekly meetings, & our ‚Äúcompulsory‚Äù Nandos post-meetings too! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer
relevanceReasoning: Sri Lankan Society hosts a large event ('Sapphire') and aims to share their culture, making them very appealing to a broad audience.
suggestedApproach: Promote 'Sapphire' and their cultural events widely to attract attendees from across the UK.

name: Women in Business
description: build a network of aspiring women. We intend to do this by providing them with the necessary skills required to be at the forefront of any business. Our mission is to equip our members with the tools to enter the business world through  access to an incredible network of supportive women, exclusive resources, and connections with leading employers. Our society holds number of inspirational events through the year such as soft skill building workshops, mentorship programs, Q&A's, informal coffee chats with employers and and office visits! Connect with us and reach out with any questions! Email: imperialwib@imperial.ac.uk Facebook: Imperial College Women in Business Instagram: @imperialwib LinkedIn: Imperial College Women in Business (ICWB) CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

name: Women in SET
description: Furthermore, we partner with global companies to bring you CV workshops, interview and internship advice, company insights etc. and help you grow your network. Our annual events include: 1) Annual Industry Networking Event: all our sponsors are invited and offer a large networking platform 2) International Women's Day Formal Dinner: our members get the chance to have a fancy 3-course meal sitting right next to senior female representatives coming from our sponsor firms! We held it at the Dorchester Hotel with 100 people in 23/24! We also raise awareness about STEM opportunities among girls at high schools. We have partnered with charities and conduct STEM workshops at different schools and encourage students to pursue a career in STEM - great opportunity to volunteer with us! We also plan talks with renowned academics from Imperial and other unis to talk about their work and challenges faced throughout their career. Lastly, we plan A LOT of social events: movie nights, boat parties, bowling, dinners, picnics and more! Some of our sponsors include: Google, Bloomberg, Bank of America, Jane Street, Marshall Wace, Jefferies, ARM and more! So, join us (for free!) to be a part of Imperial‚Äôs largest community of women and help shape your career! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

name: A Cappella
description: The Imperielles (all-female, contemporary) The Scopes (mixed, contemporary) Take Note (all-female, barbershop) The Techtonics (all-male, contemporary) Surcery (mixed, fusion style) Nth Harmonic (mixed, contemporary/close harmony) All of these groups were founded within the past 14 years, and range in intensity and development. Activities undertaken by the groups include an all-expenses paid tour to Hong Kong (which included two performances to a sold-out 3500-seater stadium), appearing on TV shows, winning and placing highly at international competitions in NYC, semi-professional tours to all over America and Canada, celebrity-endorsed professional music videos, studio recorded albums, sell-out performances at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, corporate backed flash mobs and much much more... but above all we love having fun with the society as a whole. If you would like to sign up for an audition or simply would like to find out more about the society, please visit our website: https://www.union.ic.ac.uk/arts/acappella/ our facebook page: www.facebook.com/ICUACappella/ our Instagram: @icacappella or send us an email: acappella@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: A cappella groups often perform publically and are enjoyable for a wide audience.

name: Australian
description: We hold regular relaxed social events, including celebration of Australian Holidays and sports matches to casual BBQs. From brunch to fairy bread, vegemite to a proper coffee, we're perfect for anyone who's up for meeting new people and chilling over good food, in true Aussie fashion. So whether you're looking for a home away from home or just want to learn about a nation that has so much more to offer than holiday destinations, come join us at AusSoc. We're a friendly group of people who are welcoming to all! Aussie Aussie Aussie! P.S. Watch out for those drop bears CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Australian society organizes relaxed social events and celebrations, suitable for a broader audience.

name: Baking
description: Welcome to Baking Society, where the aroma of freshly baked goods fills the air and you are our secret ingredient! Whether you're a seasoned pro or a beginner eager to explore the world of baking, there's something for every baker here! From sharing recipes or following GBBO to hands-on workshops and friendly bake-offs, we've got a tasty mix of activities! Getting involved is as easy as pie, simply join us to become a member today! Look out for our emails or follow us on Instagram for the latest updates on our upcoming events and activities! name: Bangladeshi
description: Starting university can be a daunting experience. We‚Äôre here to alleviate that pressure by helping you connect with new people and get involved with some great events and initiatives. We‚Äôve got tonnes of events lined up, including lighthearted games nights and cultural events to get in touch with Bangladeshi heritage. Look out for Maa month in February where we dedicate a month‚Äôs worth of events to raising money for the Maternal Aid Association. This money will help mothers in rural and developing areas of Bangladesh and Afghanistan. Our fan favourite wing crawl is sure to get your attention and it gets better and better each year. This year we will also be implementing Bangla language lessons. This could be a fun way to reconnect with your mother tongue, or a chance to learn a new language entirely. Come give it a shot to see if you could be the next big Bangla poet. And there‚Äôs so much more! We are a cultural society focused on helping our members throughout uni, and making their experience unforgettable. We look forward to seeing you at our events! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Bangladeshi society promotes culture and events that attract a wide range of students.

name: Benelux Society
description: Whether you are from the Benelux or simply interested in our culture, we welcome any member to join us in the great adventure that comes with being a member of ICBenelux. Expect Pub Crawls, Dinners, cross university meetups, BNL food and drinks (waffles, beers, poffertjes, chocolate, ... ), and many more! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

name: Chamber Choir
description: We perform up to two concerts per term and sing fortnightly Wednesday evensongs at Holy Trinity Church, Prince Consort Road. We regularly undertake various external projects such as recently recording a BBC radio 3 evensong, joint concerts with other established choirs, various cathedral evensongs such as Southwark and much more! Taking our music outside of college is very important to us, and we go on a weekend away, 5 day Easter tour and a week-long summer tour throughout the year. Our summer tours are a highlight of the year, both musically and socially. Recent tours have included: Porto, Portugal (2017), Ljubljana, Slovenia (2018), Krakow, Poland (2019), Tuscany, Italy (2022) and Galicia, Spain (2023), Estonia and Finland (2024) singing high-calibre choral music in and around their most famous venues. We are currently preparing to record a new CD in June centred around the theme of "Home" with Convivium Records! We welcome new members to our annual auditions that run in October. For any queries, please contact the Chair, Olivia Priestland, using the email address on the right-hand side of this page. Please check out our website to stay up to date with all of our upcoming events: https://icchamberchoir.org/ and our incredible socials @icchamberchoir CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
relevanceReasoning: Chamber Choir could collaborate with other university music groups and perform for a broader audience.
suggestedApproach: Suggest cross-university collaborations to expand their performance reach.

name: Chamber Music
description: Whether you're a seasoned performer, a 'retired' instrumentalist, an inexperienced player, or don't play an instrument; if you love music of any type, we have something to offer! Members can enjoy: 1) Forming and performing in your own ensembles (pianists are welcome!) 2) Joining competitions, workshops and masterclasses 3) Performing in concerts, formal and casual, solo and in an ensemble 4) Attending a broad range of concerts in and out of Imperial (subsidised by the society!) and 5) Gatherings with FOOD! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

name: Choir
description: We are a choir of about 100 members, comprising students, staff and alumni. Our rehearsals are on Thursdays from 18:00-20:30, where we learn our termly repertoire with our wonderful conductor and accompanist. The pieces we sing, both long and short, range from old classics to more modern and contemporary pieces; there is something in it for everyone. Every year we hold several concerts, where we collaborate with orchestras, ensembles and soloists, performing in venues ranging from small Churches to the Royal Albert Hall for Imperial College‚Äôs yearly Commemoration events. Join us at choir pub after rehearsals, and come along to socials, which could be anything from ice-skating over Karaoke, or weekend trips to different cities and even trips abroad to perform concerts. If you simply enjoy singing, want to connect with people outside of your course or are looking for a break from your daily routine, come to Choir! We look forward to seeing you. For more information, check out our Linktree. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
relevanceReasoning: Choir concerts are open to everyone and could be heavily promoted and attract a large audience.

name: Consultancy
description: Consulting is an up-and-coming industry aiming to provide innovative solutions to real-world problems, assist large companies around the globe to create value and fulfil their corporate mission. The Imperial College Consultancy Society (ICCS) is the leading student society that caters to everyone keen on consulting or wishing to pursue a career in consultancy. We have developed an extensive network with top tier consulting firms and provide platforms where our members can meet and network while learning from our sponsors. ICCS also runs a variety of training programs such as our in-house Case Study Club, as well as our Imperial Consulting Group (ICG) subsidiary, where you can gain genuine consulting experience. Moreover, this year we have joined the Global Research and Consulting (GRC) group alongside Harvard, The Wharton School, Cambridge, Oxford and other top universities. Obtain our free membership today to enjoy access to our exclusive opportunities and resources. Visit our website for more information and events:  https://iccsoc.com/ CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Consultancy is a broad field and the society holds networking events that will appeal across unis.
suggestedApproach: Suggest to promote networking events and workshops related to consulting careers.

name: Dance Club
description: With dancing being one of the best ways of staying active, IC Dance Club offers Ballroom (Waltz, Tango, Viennese Waltz, Foxtrot, Quickstep), Latin (Cha Cha, Samba, Rumba, Paso Doble, Jive), Salsa, and Bachata classes and socials fostered in a passionate environment with club spirit at its heart. name: Data Science
description: With a student reach across all major departments, the Imperial College Data Science Society (ICDSS) promotes data science awareness amongst the student body. The combination of data science and big data has been shifting the paradigm of many fields including but not limited to drug discovery, investment, and business strategy. ICDSS‚Äôs goal is to equip all interested students with key data science skills and bridge the gap between industry and academia. We do this by providing students with industry insights, skill development workshops, hackathons, and projects to practice the art of data science. The talents we develop help meet the high demands of various industries for data scientists. Look out for us on social media; we're active on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and you can also find out more on our website: www.imperialdatasoc.co.uk. You can reach us via email at icdss@ic.ac.uk CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer
relevanceReasoning: Data Science society allows all depts to participate.
suggestedApproach: Emphasize industry-academia bridge.

name: Developer Student Club
description: Over the first chapter in 2022, our community has grown to over 400 members, reinforcing our commitment to expanding tech literacy. Our extensive pipeline of events include: ‚Ä¢	Workshops: Designed to impart hands-on tech skills and learn as a community. ‚Ä¢	DSC AI Summit: An arena for data enthusiasts to wrangle with real-world challenges. ‚Ä¢	Guest Sessions: Invitations to industry professionals who bring with them a wealth of experience and pioneering insights. ‚Ä¢	GDG Academy Mentorship Program: Building bridges between students and seasoned leaders, focusing on career guidance and professional development. Furthermore, DSC provides substantial networking avenues, fostering connection and collaboration between students and professionals from a myriad of technological disciplines. We strive to continuously organise enriching initiatives and propel the growth of our community. Our mission is to move the needle at Imperial with a project-based, industry-led approach to enable students from all backgrounds to actualise their interest in Software Engineering. Our vision is to establish an inclusive community of innovators and life-long learners that partners with companies, non-profits, and organisations in pursuit of social good. Join us: Participate in a series of exciting events, workshops, and ideathons that will help you advance in the tech industry and extend your professional network. DSC sincerely welcomes students regardless of academic background. CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Great for networking, skill dev
suggestedApproach: Workshops and mentorship program are great.

name: DoCSoc
description: To keep you on your toes, we run tons of tech talks from the likes of Meta, Bloomberg, Google, Palantir, and more. In the past we‚Äôve hosted talks and workshops centred around machine learning, blockchain technology and sentiment analysis, to name a few examples. We also host workshops centred around learning particular technologies such as Docker or React Native. Or join us at our annual flagship hackathon, IC Hack, where the best innovators from Imperial and beyond gather to build some extremely cool tech, all in 24 hours. If free sponsor merch, food from the likes Nando's, Dominos, and more, or random karaoke sessions are not enough, we don't know what is! It's not all about ones and zeroes though. We organise a whole bunch of social events from  theatre trips, ice skating, trampolining and more, all subsidised by a HUGE amount. We also host our own yearly club night, Revel, along with our traditional black-tie End Of Year Dinner. And who could forget our legendary bar nights at the Union? DoCSoc is run by DoC students, for DoC students (and for anyone interested in computing!), all to make your time at Imperial as enjoyable and rewarding as we can. Get involved! To get in touch, please send an email to docsoc@imperial.ac.uk. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Tech events are cool.
suggestedApproach: Partner up with Meta and Google to promote.

name: Environmental
description: Does the hustling London life make you want to slow down and enjoy nature? Are you anxious about the climate crisis we are currently facing? Do you want to have a more sustainable and green lifestyle? Come join ESoc! Join us at our very own secret garden for weekly gardening sessions where we grow fruit, vegetables, flowers, or simply come and chat with other members. Have a go at taking care of our lovely beehives at our beekeeping workshops during spring and summer. You don't need any experience to take part! To play our part in facing current environmental issues, we hold monthly campaign meetings in attempt to make our campus more sustainable and spark climate action. We host talks from guest speakers that discuss issues around climate, conservation, and sustainability, or provide career insights in the green sector through careers fairs. We also run sustainability workshops that teach you how to make your own eco-items such as beeswax food wraps, and fun socials like clothes swaps, thrift crawls, or Kew Gardens visits. Come along to meet like-minded people and have fun! Join our mailing list or follow our socials for the latest updates from us! CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Environmental society has activities such as gardening that will appeal to students beyond Imperial.
suggestedApproach: Suggest a cross-university gardening or sustainability workshop to promote green living.

name: Fashion & Design
description: In 2024 we will again be holding our biggest event: the Imperial College Charity Fashion Show. ICCFS is going to be the biggest event this year - showcasing the fleekest trends, hottest acts and the sexiest models. Watch out for our models' auditions! If you are interested in organizing or backstage roles, please reach out as we still have a few positions to fill! CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Fashion & Design society organizes a Charity Fashion Show and other events, which can attract a wide audience.
suggestedApproach: Offer to promote their fashion show and model auditions to students at other arts-focused universities.

name: Finance
description: Our events are aimed at providing our members with information about job opportunities in the City, a chance to talk to and network with industry contacts, and information useful for succeeding in your later career. We also hope to give members a chance to learn about what a job in the industry consists of, and if it's something that they'd be interested in pursuing. We specifically promote roles in investment banks, accountancy firms, private equity, hedge funds, and investment managers, and supplement your education with material helpful to applications and interviews. With a wide range of opportunities such as speeches from leading experts in their fields, term-long trading competitions, and even office visits, there are events for everyone with an interest in our field or even just curiosity to learn more. And as membership is free, there's no reason to not join! WORKING WEBSITE LINK BELOW! FIND OUT EVERYTHING ABOUT OUR EVENTS AND SIGN UP TO LECTURE COURSES ON WEBSITE CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Finance society is a popular society which offers career opportunities for students across London.
suggestedApproach: Suggest promoting their finance career workshops to a wider audience across London universities.

name: Gaming and Esports
description: Joining a team is one of the best ways to have a tight circle of players from Imperial, whether you're looking to compete at the highest level in the national university leagues, or just to play casual weekly games. Our annual Varsity LAN against UCL is our keystone event of the year, hosted either on-site or in one of London's largest esports studios. You'll also have opportunities to meet other student gamers within Central London by joining our viewing parties of international tournaments, our socials, or by getting involved in our annual charity livestream! For those who are less interested in the competitive side, we run weekly in-person gaming sessions on Wednesday afternoons playing all sorts of console-based games. ICLGE has several consoles, Nintendo Switches and a huge selection of games to choose from during our meetups! The best way to stay updated is by joining our Discord server: https://discord.com/invite/CNJ5S25 CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer
relevanceReasoning: Gaming and Esports have a large student base, thus giving them a wider appeal across universities.
suggestedApproach: Suggest promoting their events to other London university students interested in Gaming and Esports.

name: Gospel Choir
description: We are a diverse bunch of people and everyone is most welcome to join our family - even if you have never sung Gospel before! We have enjoyed performing in a wide variety of events from our own Christmas and Easter concerts to being one of the 8 finalists at the University Gospel Choir of the Year Competition in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2015. We regularly perform at events staged by fellow Imperial societies as well as external events which have included backing X-Factor finalists on live television, performing on Premier Gospel Radio and at the Great Exhibition Road Festival as well as many Imperial College society performances (East Meets West, Mega Maalai, UNICEF, Afrogala). We rehearse weekly on Mondays from 6pm in the City and Guild Building, Room 300. We frequently have socials (often involving food) so there is always something to look forward to! We hope to see you soon! A good voice is not a prerequisite; all you need is enthusiasm and a heart for community! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer
relevanceReasoning: Gospel Choir can host shows and events to a large audience due to their singing talent.
suggestedApproach: Offer to promote their performances to a wider audience across London universities.

name: Imperial Ceilidh Society
description: A Ceilidh (pronounced kay-lee) is a social gathering with traditional Scottish and Irish folk music and social dancing. Each Ceilidh is led by a Caller, who guides you through the dances, ensuring everyone is up to speed and no one‚Äôs feet are squashed in the process. No previous experience is required- all dances will be taught on the night (just bring your enthusiasm and possible enjoyment of getting dizzy)! Even if you're not sure about dancing, you can still come for the live music and see how you feel as the night goes on! Ceilidhs are also a great way to meet new people and make new friends, so even more reason to bring your friends along and get mingling! If any of this sounds up your street, then sign up to our mailing list below and we‚Äôll let you know when the next event will be. Everyone is welcome, so get your dancing shoes on (or just regular ones if you don‚Äôt have any) and see you soon! CALLING ALL IMPERIAL MUSICIANS: We are always looking for more eager musicians to join our Ceilidh Band! If you have experience playing folk music or would like to try it out for the first time, don‚Äôt hesitate to add your name, instrument and email to the form below, and we‚Äôll get in touch! Musician Sign Up Form 2025-2026 Mailing List Sign Up Form 2025-2026 CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: Ceilidh Society's social gatherings with music and dancing have broad appeal, particularly with the caller guiding participants.
suggestedApproach: Promote their ceilidh events as fun social gatherings open to all London university students, emphasizing the beginner-friendly nature.

name: Investment
description: We give you the knowledge, network, and experience to break into finance. Whether you are a fresher or a postgrad, ICIS is the place to learn, connect, and stand out. name: IQ (Imperial College LGBT+)
description: Our goal is to offer a friendly welcoming space for all students across the LGBTQ+ community, regardless of where you are in the process of coming out and whether you're a fresher or in your final year. Every week during term time we aim to run at least one event where you can meet other LGBTQ+ folks, be it a quiet film evening, a big night out, a cultural day trip or on tour. We recognise the fantastic diversity within the LGBTQ+ community and that our experiences are not the same, therefore we also organise events to offer seperate spaces for specific subgroups within our community. These are run by our intersectional officers: If you ever feel uncomfortable, want someone to talk to regarding your sexual orientation and gender identity or have suffered anti-LGBTQ+ discrimination, our Welfare Officer is here to help. They're your first point of contact for existing College and Union support services and are there if you just want a quiet chat. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: IQ (Imperial College LGBT+) offers a welcoming space and social events that would greatly benefit from a larger, more diverse audience.
suggestedApproach: Suggest cross-university collaborations with other LGBTQ+ societies to increase attendance at their social events.

name: Irish
description: Whether you're Irish, a lover of Irish culture, or have never even been to Ireland, this is the society for you! Join us for good craic and become part of our Irish community. Everyone knows that no one parties harder than the Irish, so be prepared for class events, including pub crawls, ceilidhs and karaoke nights! And you won‚Äôt want to miss out on our annual St Patrick's Day celebrations. ‚Äú11/10 would join again if I was still at Imperial‚Äù ‚Äì past member ‚ÄúPassing up an event with the Irish Society is like turning down free food, something a student should never do‚Äù ‚Äì current member ‚ÄúYou guys are all so friendly! I love you!‚Äù ‚Äì random man in bar from Irish Society Pub Crawl 2016 With membership free this year, there is no excuse not to join. Follow our instagram @icirishsoc to keep up with the events and craic through the year. CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

name: Musical Theatre
description: Do you love to sing? Got a passion for acting? Can't help but dance when you hear that beat? Musical Theatre Society (MTSoc) has been putting on spectacular shows for over 60 years, and we would love you to join our long tradition! Whether you want to join the cast and be in the spotlight, jump into the pit as part of our incredible band, or bring your ideas to life as a director, choreographer or musical director, you are sure to have a great time with MTSoc! Previous shows include "Legally Blonde", "In The Heights", "Sweeney Todd", "Grease", "The Addams Family" and many more! We have an ever-expanding number of shows including our full scale Spring Show, 24-hour musical, and our annual Revue, alongside great socials, cabarets and workshops, giving you plenty of great ways to get involved. With rehearsals on Sundays, Mondays and Tuesdays, we offer the perfect way to unwind from Imperial life. To find out more about MTSoc, check us out on Facebook & Insta, on our website mtsoc.co.uk, or find us at the Fresher's Fair! name: Nordic
description: Our society goes beyond stereotypes, organizing dinners, lectures, and cultural experiences that showcase the vibrant tapestry of Nordic traditions, arts, and history. These events celebrate the unique contributions of the Nordic region to the world. Some examples of what we did last year was Kubb tournaments in Hyde Park, Nordic board game nights, Swedish Christmas concert, of course a pub crawl incorporating some Nordic inspired bars, and an ABBA party with other Nordic societies! Additionally, we foster connections between our members and the Nordic industrial, financial, and professional presence in the UK. By inviting influential Nordic individuals based in the UK, we offer exclusive insights, inspirational talks, and career events with Nordic companies. Building a strong network within and beyond Imperial College is our mission. An example is the careers talk we held with Norway‚Äôs Sovereign Wealth fund last year. Have questions or simply want to chat? Find us at our stall during the Freshers' Fair. We can't wait to meet you and welcome you to our vibrant Nordic community. Join us in celebrating the richness and diversity of our Nordic heritage! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

name: Northern Society
description: We aim to create a community for all that‚Äôs as friendly and welcoming as the North itself, while widening appreciation of Northern Culture amongst the student body through our themed events. As a member you will be able to participate in our events at a discount or absolutely free. Here‚Äôs what we hope to bring you this year: Fortnightly mingles wi brews and biccies ‚Äì a chance to meet and chat to Imperial‚Äôs Northerners. A classic, but Northern. Northern bands, Northern bangers. Get on your dancing shoes! While our primary objectives are to provide our members and the wider college community with a taste of the North, we also aim to promote awareness of the persistent inequality between the North and South of England. CSP Chair / President

name: Pakistan
description: Our mission is to be a hub of cultural exchange and celebration. Throughout the year, we strive to bring you a diverse range of events that showcase the best of Pakistan. From our mouthwatering Nashta mornings featuring classic Pakistani cuisine and steaming cups of chai, to adrenaline-pumping inter-society sports battles ‚Äì we've got it all covered! But that's not all. Our calendar is brimming with socials that'll keep the energy and excitement alive. However, the crown jewel of our events is undoubtedly 'SHAAM‚Äô, our flagship charity dinner. It's an evening you won't want to miss, where we combine delicious food, cultural performances, and a strong sense of community to make a meaningful impact. After a sold-out dinner last year and stellar performances, we're working hard to make this year's SHAAM even more spectacular, so stay tuned! If you‚Äôre a fan of chilled get-togethers, competitive bowling missions and huge laughs, PakSoc is the society for you! Whether you're a homegrown talent or an international student, we're here to welcome you with open arms and a warm cup of chai. To get to know us better, make sure to drop by our booth at the Freshers' Fair ‚Äì because you definitely don't want to miss out on the incredible journey that awaits you with Pakistan Society! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

name: Photosoc
description: Every week we head off to an interesting part of London to take photos or visit an exhibition in some of London's many galleries. Every term we run a comprehensive series of tutorials on camera technique and darkroom technique. As well as providing a meeting place for those passionate about photography. We also provide a fully equipped darkroom, media hub for editing photos and loan out equipment. More information can be found at our website below, or you can also find us on facebook at ICU Photosoc. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

name: Pop of East Asia Society
description: Do you enjoy East Asian Pop music? Are you a musician or an eager audience member? Then PEASOC (Pop of East Asia) is perfect for you! We do weekly alternating more formal band practices and casual jams of (mostly) East Asian Pop music (Cantopop, J-pop, Chinese pop, etc.) Each member can put forward songs of their choice and we will do the songs by rotation. name: Radio
description: IC Radio is among the oldest student radio stations in the country. Started in 1976, broadcasting on a home built AM transmitter around halls, we now broadcast all over the globe from icradio.com. Absolutely anyone is welcome to try their hand at presenting or producing a show; whatever your music taste. We also love a good speech based program, so anyone will feel at home in IC Radio. As well as being able to broadcast, we are lucky enough to have a brand new, fully equipped recording studio which we use to record bands and musicians. Behind the scenes we rely on our fantastic technical, musical and promotional teams. Are you interested in web design? Want to record professional band and artists? Maybe you fancy running our IT system? There's a place for you here and we'd love for you to join us! Make sure to follow us on our socials CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
relevanceReasoning: Radio society broadcasts shows that can reach an audience beyond Imperial and encourages anyone to join.

name: Somali Society
description: Welcome to Imperial Somali Society, a newly-founded home for those who are Somali or interested in learning and celebrating the Somali culture! This year, we plan to bring SomSoc to life with events to introduce you to fellow Somali students, keep you in contact with people to support you during your time at uni and get to learn more about our people and culture. We hope to see you there! We are committed to forming a presence at Imperial, forming a family-like community that focuses on helping our newest students settle into life at uni, as well as reigniting our love for our background and keeping in touch with our roots. name: South Asian Society
description: We will start the year out with our 'Meet and Greet' in which students can meet our committee as well as other students. Our bowling, crazy golf and games nights will allow you to get to know new people and get into the competitive spirit, whilst our shisha nights and dinner gatherings are the perfect ways to unwind after stressful days. In South Asian Society we want to create a 'home from home'; our 'Asoc families' scheme will give you the opportunity to meet like-minded students from different years with whom you can form close friendships. If you are interested in learning more about South Asian culture, our informative talks and enlightening social media posts will give you the opportunity to educate yourself, whilst our debates will allow you to express your own opinions and appreciate the opinions of others. We look forward to seeing all of you at Freshers Fair this year and welcoming you into our vibrant community! Follow our instagram @ic.asoc to keep up with our latest news and updates! CSP Chair / President
relevanceReasoning: South Asian Society hosts various social and cultural events, making it appealing to a broad audience interested in South Asian culture.

name: Spanish
description: It is our gusto, as the official Spanish Society at Imperial College, to welcome you to a close-knit community of Spanish (and Spanish-speaking) students, as well as the main hub of Spanish culture promotion amongst all other students. We enjoy living Spanish culture along the lines of its founding values; familiarity, solidarity and determined optimism. With activities ranging from organised Reggaeton club outings, to Tapas nights, from an intra-societal football league to Mus tournaments, we offer a myriad of activities to reflect how diverse the Spanish culture is. This year, we will also have the opportunity of attending cultural, social and gastronomical events by Spanish artists and personalities across London, and we will arrange informative talks with distinguished companies and personalities. We are here to make you feel at home, be it on a Sunday during a LaLiga match, or whilst you enjoy learning how to make tortilla de patata (con o sin cebolla?). CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

These groups are open to all flautists and clarinettists, not just those who play in Wind Band ‚Äì if you like playing with other flutes or clarinets, or want to try other types of flutes or clarinets, then flute and clarinet choir are for you!
